intro: Nanorrhinum brunneri, commonly known as the narrow-lobed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits. Nanorrhinum brunneri is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in full sun.
